meanings.definition: The act of preserving a dead body by treating it with chemicals.
meanings.sent1: The embalmment of the deceased helped keep their body from decaying.
meanings.sent2: The funeral home performed the embalmment on the deceased before the viewing.
meanings.sent3: During the embalmment process, the mortician accidentally spilled some chemicals on their own shoes.
meanings.sent4: The embalmment turned the once pale body into a lifelike figure for the funeral.
meanings.sent5: The embalmment room had a strong smell of chemicals, making it a memorable experience.

meanings.definition: The process of preparing a deceased person for burial by preserving their body.
meanings.sent1: The embalmment of the deceased was done with great care and respect.
meanings.sent2: Families often choose embalmment to ensure their loved one looks peaceful during the funeral.
meanings.sent3: The embalmment process took longer than expected due to the condition of the body.
meanings.sent4: The embalmment transformed the deceased into a serene and dignified appearance.
meanings.sent5: The embalmment artist skillfully restored the natural look of the deceased for the service.
